properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued February 16 at 1:30AM PST until February 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Choppy wind driven seas of 8 to 9 ft transition to swell
dominated and become less steep this morning. Seas become wind
driven again early Tuesday morning, becoming steep at 7 to 9 ft
through Tuesday evening. North winds of 15 to 20 kt increase to
20 to 35 kt Monday afternoon, persisting through Tuesday
evening.

* WHERE...Advisory level conditions will be mostly south of Coos
Bay through Tuesday morning, expanding north to include areas
south of Reedsport Tuesday afternoon. The steepest seas and
strongest winds will be generally be beyond 5 nm from shore,
except closer to shore in the vicinity of Cape Blanco.

* WHEN...For the current Small Craft Advisory, until 4 AM PST
early this morning. For the next Small Craft Advisory, from 4
PM Monday to 10 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds and/or steep seas could capsize or
damage smaller vessels.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should remain in port and avoid the area of hazardous
conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY
